Busy Boy = Few Updates (updated!)

  • warning: fopen() [function.fopen]: Filename cannot be empty in /nfs/c04/h01/mnt/66721/domains/themonthlychallenge.com/tags/release-1.1/includes/file.inc on line 757.
  • The file could not be created.
  • warning: fopen() [function.fopen]: Filename cannot be empty in /nfs/c04/h01/mnt/66721/domains/themonthlychallenge.com/tags/release-1.1/includes/file.inc on line 757.
  • The file could not be created.
  • warning: fopen() [function.fopen]: Filename cannot be empty in /nfs/c04/h01/mnt/66721/domains/themonthlychallenge.com/tags/release-1.1/includes/file.inc on line 757.

Mon, 07/21/2008 - 00:06 | by Jesse

I've been working pretty long hours the past few weeks. On Friday though, I got out of work at a reasonable time, then went to see Darker My Love at the echo. They were pretty good, although a bit more psychedelic than I was expecting. Saturday was just as busy as the rest of the week. I woke up early and bought a new computer and a new desk. Then I went to see The Dark Knight, followed by a house party and ended up at the Glow Festival in Santa Monica.

The Glow Festival was basically just thousands of drunk and/or high/stoned people walking around shooting the shit. There wasn't really a whole lot going on. We went down to the beach and it did look there may have been something going on under the boardwalk, but after walking around and talking to some people, it became pretty evident that I was way too sober and not nearly on enough drugs (read: zero) to enjoy their company. I should've gone to see A Clockwork Orange at the Hollywood Forever Cemetery.

Yea, A Clockwork Orange would've been way better. Maybe I can make up for missing it by going to see a revival screening of War Games this week. I saw a revival screening of Fast Times at Ridgemont High a few weeks ago that was really fun. AFI and Fathom Events have a few more decent screenings coming up.

Today, I managed to wake up before noon so that I had just enough time to grab a quick bite and shower before heading over to the Download Festival at the Gibson Ampitheatre. I got to see bands like Ghostland Observatory (it's always fun watching hundreds of people dance all crazy-like), M83 (awesome), Mutemath (overly energetic?), Mates of State (pretty good pop rock), and Tapes 'n Tapes (meh), although I did miss Datarock who I really wanted to see. But, it was definitely worth the money. Plus, apparently if you walk around to the Gibson Ampitheatre, it's incredibly easy to sneak into Universal Studios and go on the Simpsons Ride.

This week, I will finish redesigning my personal site and launch it (it's been at about 90% for the past week or so), as well as begin designing a portfolio site for myself and a personal website for my brother. And hopefully this weekend, I can hit up MOCA (finally) and the Getty.
